result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Goss Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine of $2,400.00. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
Any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device
IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and compliance with treatment
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John J Goss Jr in court.  Attorney William Edward Keeler Iii in court for John J Goss Jr.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS and 8 MONTHS, credit for 3 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 14 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Pay a fine of $2,400.
- Court ordered defendants operation privileges revoked for 24 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.
- Court ordered any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 MONTHS.
- IDP Related Offense Driver assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- NO CONTACT with Captain Nicks.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and any other programming deemed appropriate by DOC.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*Court vacates jury trial dates.
Sentencing memorandum, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
on behalf of defendant, filed.

Defendant John J Goss Jr in court.  Attorney William Edward Keeler Iii in court for John J Goss Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant is in treatment and defense is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial date scheduled. Court leaves matter scheduled for jury trial, vacates current final pretrial date and reschedules final pretrial. All conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Keeler filed a letter to the court regarding defendant's potential application for entry into Veterans' Treatment Court.  Court scheduled a status conference to address this matter.  Case adjourned until August 30, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.

Defendant John J Goss in court with attorney William Edward Keeler.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a scheduling date. Court sets case for trial.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John J Goss in court with attorney William Edward Keeler.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference.  Defense counsel awaiting blood results and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:39 PM Defendant John J Goss in court with Attorney William Edward Keeler; both appear in person.  Adam Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
